sections.title: References

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable as gene abbreviations are used in scientific references.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: The gene ADCYAP1 is mentioned in the title without italics.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Strong adherence as gene abbreviations are used, but not italicized as per guidelines.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Recommended to use gene abbreviations instead of full names in citations.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: Gene abbreviations are used instead of full names in all references.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Complete adherence with usage of gene abbreviations.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: No direct mention of human gene names in the reference titles.
No mention of protein names within this section.
American or British English usage is relevant for consistent citation formatting.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: Consistent language usage is noted throughout the references.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: Complete adherence to consistent language use.

sections.meta_notes: The references section is mostly compliant with gene nomenclature and abbreviation guidelines, with minor improvements needed for italicizing gene symbols.
